alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:09PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong winds and blowing dust are possible across portions of western Churchill, northwestern Mineral, southern Washoe and northern Lyon Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 659 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary a a line extending from near Fernley to 19 miles west of Walker Lake. Movement was east at 20 mph. This outflow boundary may loft dust off the Carson Sink and other dry lake beds. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause blowing dust, which could limit visibility below 1 mile. Rough lake waters can be expected on Lahontan Reservoir. Locations impacted include... US Highway 50 east of Silver Springs to Fallon and US Highway 95 north of Schurz to Trinity Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Avoid driving in blowing dust. If caught in dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. If recreating on Lake Lahontan, get off the lake immediately.

area.areaDesc: Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
